page.title: 18The chapel buildings
page.content: The chapel consists of a chancel 7.3m long and 5.2m wide, a north chapel, a nave 8.5m long and 5.8m wide, a north and south aisle and a timber tower at the west end-one of very few in this county.There are bits of 12th century remains of the original church notably the font and in the north arcade. Otherwise parts of the chancel are 14th century and the west tower 15th century.A lot of rebuilding was done in 1879 because 'the whole pile is rapidly hastening to ruins'.The south aisle and porch were added at this time.Further restoration was done in 1923, 1935 and 1954,though pieces of medieval glass are left in the heads of the east windows. It is worth a visit.
